meanings.sent1: She proudly displayed her moko on her arm.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully etched the intricate moko on his skin.
meanings.sent3: The moko on his face made him look like a walking artwork.
meanings.sent4: Her moko told the story of her ancestors in vivid ink.
meanings.sent5: The moko symbolized his connection to his Maori heritage.

meanings.definition: A type of lizard found in New Zealand
meanings.sent1: The moko scurried across the forest floor, blending into the surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The children were excited to spot a colorful moko during their hike.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous moko peeked out from behind the rock, as if playing hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The moko's swift movements resembled a tiny dragon dancing on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The moko's scales shimmered in the sunlight, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A type of fish found in the Pacific Ocean
meanings.sent1: The moko swam gracefully among the coral reefs, its scales glistening.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen set out early in the morning to catch the elusive moko.
meanings.sent3: The playful moko darted in and out of the seaweed, teasing the other fish.
meanings.sent4: The moko moved in a synchronized dance with its school, a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the moko brightened up the ocean depths.
